qas.question: What is the size of Iran?
What latitudes does Iran lie between?
What longitudes does Iran lie between?
Where does Iran border the Persian Gulf and the Gulf of Oman?
What does Iran border with to its north?

context: Iran has an area of <a0_0>1,648,195 km2 (636,372 sq mi)<a0_0/>. Iran lies between latitudes <a1_0>24° and 40° N<a1_0/>, and longitudes <a2_0>44° and 64° E<a2_0/>. Its borders are with Azerbaijan (611 km or 380 mi, with Azerbaijan-Naxcivan exclave, 179 km or 111 mi) and Armenia (35 km or 22 mi) to the north-west; <a4_0>the Caspian Sea<a4_0/> to the north; Turkmenistan (992 km or 616 mi) to the north-east; Pakistan (909 km or 565 mi) and Afghanistan (936 km or 582 mi) to the east; Turkey (499 km or 310 mi) and Iraq (1,458 km or 906 mi) to the west; and finally the waters of the Persian Gulf and the Gulf of Oman <a3_0>to the south<a3_0/>.
